static const int debug = 0

Detailed Description

New lockless timer API, inspired by ODP timer definition.

Revision
95861

Define Documentation

#define _Atomic
#define AMM   memory_order_seq_cst

Default atomic memory model, be conservative for now.

cvmx_timer_handle_t *  handle 
)

Cancel a timeout using the handle returned from cvmx_timer_arm.

Returns:
Returns the work entry pointer that was associated with the cancelled timeout.

uint64_t cvmx_timer_current_tick ( cvmx_timer_id_t  timer_id  ) 

Return current timer tick value in 'internal_ticks' = requested min_tmo / 2).

This should be used to convert relative to absolute timeouts

cvmx_timer_status_t cvmx_timer_destroy ( cvmx_timer_id_t  timer_id,
const char *  _name 
)

Destroy a shared timer.

The application is required to make sure all timeouts have expired prior to destroying the ring to avoid memory leaks.

static unsigned cvmx_timer_max_ring_exp ( void   )  [static]

Hardware-specific maximum ring size (i.e.

number of buckets) Return <n> where 2^n is the maximum ring size. Internal use function. This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

uint64_t cvmx_timer_maximum_tmo ( cvmx_timer_id_t  timer_id  ) 

Return maximum timeout value for a timer in timer ticks it is (num_buckets-1)ticks, because current bucket should not be overwritten.

static void cvmx_timer_mem_init ( void *  ptr  )  [static]

Initialize named memory block on atomic allocation Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

static unsigned cvmx_timer_min_resolution ( void   )  [static]

Hardware-specific minimum tick resolution Returns nanosecond of minumum tick duration.

This function is called before the per-ring intialization, and may apply global initialization if required.

Internal use function. This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.
